intro: Citharexylum karstenii, commonly known as the karsten's cithara, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. Its foliage is dense and often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance. Citharexylum karstenii thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
